data.event: The county was founded in 1842 and named for General "Mad" Anthony Wayne.

event.title: was created from part of Cabell County in 1842

data.event: Wayne County, West Virginia was originally Wayne County, Virginia, which was created from part of Cabell County in 1842.
There was no white settlement in the area that became Wayne County until after 1794, due to the constant threat of Indian attack.

event.title: was made safe for white settlement in 1794

data.event: The area was made safe for white settlement in 1794 through the defeat of the Shawnee at the Battle of Fallen Timbers by General "Mad" Anthony Wayne.

event.title: came to Wayne County around the year 1800

data.event: When the first permanent European settlers came to Wayne County around the year 1800, the area was part of Kanawha County.
